meanings.definition: A state in which two things are able to exist or occur together without conflict.
meanings.sent1: The compatibility of the colors in her outfit made her stand out.
meanings.sent2: The compatibility of the puzzle pieces allowed them to fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent3: The compatibility of the flavors in the dish created a surprisingly delicious combination.
meanings.sent4: Their compatibility on the dance floor was like a well-choreographed routine.
meanings.sent5: The compatibility of their personalities was evident in their seamless teamwork.

meanings.definition: The ability of a computer or software to work with another system or program.
meanings.sent1: The new software update improved the compatibility of the program with various devices.
meanings.sent2: The compatibility of the operating system with different applications was crucial for smooth functioning.
meanings.sent3: The compatibility of the software with the printer saved the day during the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The compatibility of the coding languages was like a universal translator for computers.
meanings.sent5: The compatibility of the browser with different websites ensured a seamless browsing experience.
